page.title: 13CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: Throwley is in the North Downs Conservation Area. There are numerous footpaths and bridle ways which attract walkers to the area. Many local people ride for pleasure. The paths provide access to many fine stretches of woodland. Particular places of interest include Throwley church with its fine tombs and Tudor figures of the Sondes family, as well as the memorials to the Harris family of Belmont. There is also Arnolds Oak, where a man trap can be seen embedded in the base of a large oak tree. Belmont Park, on the Northern fringe of Throwley may eventually open to the public, following the recent death of the 5th Lord Harris. His unique collection of clocks from around the world may be on show.
